text: Amazing and delicious food! Top quality! Everything made in house. Bread was made with Guinness and molasses. Barbacoa and salmon tartar were both delicious! Bring your own wine too!

Arrivés assez tard nous avons été très bien accueillis par le serveur. La salle est belle et bien disposée. 
La viande est succulente, les plats sont frais et bien cuisinés. 

Vraiment conquise par cet endroit sans prétention et charmant !

A great neighbourhood spot. I have been now three times with three different groups of friends and we all agree -- a lovely experience with a hard-to-beat (in Montreal, anyway) price to quality ratio. The table d'hôte for $50 is a great deal -- a three course meal with house-made bread to start and a trou norman to cleanse the palate between entrée and plat principal. Looking forward to checking out their brunch in the near future!
Everything tastes delicious at this cute Bring your own wine restaurant. The chef is a gem. The sevice is great and everyone is very nice. I recommend this place to everyone.

La qualité du service est impeccable et la formule apportez votre vin très intéressante. Première déception, le menu sur internet n'est vraiment pas à jour. Malgré tout, sélection intéressante de plats gastronomiques qui nous laisseront sur notre appétit et aucune sélection pour les végétariens. La qualité des présentations et des saveurs est indéniable. La dorade était délicieuse mais les accompagnements trop rarissimes. Le tartare s'apparente plutôt à une formule tapas qu'à un plat principal. Pour le prix payé je m'attendais à beaucoup mieux. Est-ce que nous y retournerons ? Étant donné la sélection de restaurants montréalais... je ne crois pas non.

Wow and amazing !!! We were a big group and this resto really knows how to serve an excellent  food experience to a large group! This is not easy  and this resto knows how! Bravo to the chefs and staff !!

Nous y sommes allées pour Montréal à table et avons été très contentes de notre choix.
D'abord, je tiens à souligner l'excellent service, nous n'avions pas besoin de demander à chaque fois pour de l'eau ni d'attendre longtemps nos plats.
La bouffe était excellente. Le boudin en entrée était assez copieux, pas trop gras, et servi avec un petit pain brioché parfumé délicieux et moelleux. Le tartare de mon amie avait l'air très bon aussi.
Ensuite, nous avons pris la demi-caille qui venait avec une énorme pâte farfalle maison ainsi que des légumes et une saucisse. C'était très copieux et délicieux.
Enfin, nous avons goûté à la tartelette citrouille, très bonne, ainsi qu'au fondant au chocolat, délicieux également.
De plus, le resto est un apportez votre vin, ce qui est toujours plaisant!
Je pense que j'y retournerai, et je vous encourage à l'essayer également! :)

Belle découverte! Accueil chaleureux et courtois. Cuisine Française offrant de savoureuses options végétariennes servies en table d'hôte que je classe parmi les très bonnes tables végétariennes de Montréal. Un régal!

Tristement déçu par ma dernière expérience dans ce qui était un des meilleurs endroits du quartier. Malgré un repas délicieux et somptueux, la qualité de service que nous avons eu était pitoyable - notre serveur était condescendant, arrogant et impatient. Avec le choix qui existe dans notre secteur de la ville c'est certain que ma prochaine soirée sera quelque part d'autre.
Nouveau resto dans le quartier. C'est un apportez-votre-vin très honnête ($), avec une belle ambiance, qui est fréquenté par les de gens du quartier. La carte est simple et tout est bien maîtrisé.

Great location in a neighborhood but on a main street. The table d'hote  is a good deal with very interesting presentations. BYOW is another great feature. Service can be a little slow so take a date you have things to talk about or are comfortable with silence.
Ok, I'll update this to reflect great quality to price ratio and the loveliness of a quality byo in the neighbourhood.

This restaurant was near where we were staying in little Italy, and only had a couple of reviews. we loved it, the food was tremendous and the ambience was friendly and comfortable. There is a cheap depanneur across the street if you're in a pinch for a bottle of wine. We had a nice green salad with tomatoes and salted fish as a starter, and sampled both a red snapper entree and a lamb dish. Both were delicious. The service was a little slow, but for a small kitchen they plated things well and as quickly as humanly possible for their staff. Looks like they have a formidable Sunday brunch as well, we might return before the trip is over...

I received a  La Forfaiterie gift certificate for the menu "La totale" which includes a 5 course meal for 2. A mise en bouche, appetizer, trou normand, entree and dessert. The menu seems to change time to time. We started the dinner with a duck arracinhi, crispy, creamy risotto inside and a hint of duck flavour. Next we tried foie gras and beef tataki. It was like a foie gras torchon, it was good but nothing special, foie gras is foie gras always good!:) the beef tataki was the best appetizer, with a truffle cream sauce and potato crumbles. The flavour combination was well done! The beef was tender and everything was melting together. Miam!
Trou normand was a lemon sorbet with Bombay Gin, very fresh and pleasant. For the entree, i had the chance to taste the duck(magret and confite) risotto, steak and the tuna. Out of the 3, duck risotto was the best, everything was perfect, cheesy creamy risotto well cooked and the duck pieces was very tender. Delicious! The portion was big for one person. The beef was good but a bit dry maybe more sauce would have been nice. The tuna was good, i have 2 bites so.
Finally, desserts, i tried the chocolat dome with banana cream and salty caramel, flan with abricot and a lemon cake with pistachio cream. The chocolat dome was good but too sweet for me, i guess from banana and caramel combination. 1-2 spoons is sufficient, a nice dessert to share. Lemon cake was refreshing with pistachio, spongy lemony cake, i would have that again. And the flan was very light and just sweet enough. Overall excellent dessert list.
It is a BYOW neighbourhood restaurant on Beaubien in a booming area. Service is friendly. I would recommend to discover this place! Good quality food and 50$ menu for a exploration menu is very affordable!

Ok so I am from Brooklyn and I am quite familiar with hipsters and hipster restaurants this one is a true wana be. 
Reservations - don't know why I needed them 3 tables were occupied in the entire restaurant. 
Service - I did't need to feel like I wasn't welcomed or my money wasn't going to pay the waiters' rent. 
Food- truly overpriced. A cross between confusion and deconstruction. Salmon was exceptionally good but it was simply pan fried. Steak was a $28 disaster. It was a sliced skirt steak which was somewhat chewy ( probably because it wasn't sliced properly) and under seasoned. When requested bread we were told it was $3 ...hmmm I didn't ask for the price I asked for the item. 
Dessert - paNOcotta ... More like kefir. Runny milky weirdness with canned pineapple and granola on top. 
Overall not at all impressed but most of all their service was awfully disappointing. The restaurant and the staff need an identify and a smile.

Restaurant sympathique de quartier. Apportez votre vin!!! Très plaisant! 
Service efficace et attentionné.

Menu sur l'ardoise.
Cuisine intéressante mais parfois certains plats manquent de saveur.

Parfois un peu bruyant.

Bon rapport qualité/prix. Très raisonnable!

Une expérience plaisante en résumé.
Sommes allés pour une deuxième visite, samedi le 11 mars 2018.

Voilà plusieurs fois que je passe devant Lannes et Pacifiques, et leur logo / design m'a toujours beaucoup plu (quelle belle locomotive !). 

Sans déception, il s'agit d'un chouette bistrot de quartier comme il en manquait, accessible et au très bon rapport qualité-prix. Amateurs de viande (miam l'agneau !) ou de poisson au premier plan et en plus on peut apporter son vin ! Les plats, bien que plutôt classiques, sont revisités et très bien travaillés et les saveurs intéressantes. Sans parler des desserts !! (Miam la panacotta !)

Le service est rapide, agréable et disponible. Le style est intimiste et romantique. Le menu est très épuré, mais nous avons le choix entre 4 services ou à la carte. Pour tous les prix et tous les goûts !

Impressed
1/ by the quality of the food 
2/ by the menu.. which is written by chalk in the wall
3/ by the service
But what impressed me the most was
An staff of 2 in the kitchen to deliver this quality of dishes for a FULL restaurant .!!!
 At 50$ for a 5 courses table d'hôte is a bargain .!!
Am definitely coming back .!!!
The downside of my evening.... it was quiet noisy ( not the restaurant fault ) and the Trou normand ... i had better.
The rest? Well worth coming back .!!!

The bad:

First and fore most, what is the point on making reservations if you have to wait an hour before getting a table? They tried to be nice and all, but in the end my patience was tested. They added tables to a walk in and that seems to be the reason why we waited so long. Now why did we just not leave? Because they said that it would only be a 15 minutes wait and suggested we open our wine bottle to which we have agreed to. 

The good:

The waitresses were more then nice! They felt really bad and even stayed patient with us. Especially after seeing my patience and my temper getting tested. It quickly calmed me down and put a smile back on my face.

The menu is simple but refined as well for a bistro. We didn't get the table d'hôte because we usually never get to the desserts :)

I got the salmon escabeche. Tasty, fresh, well seasoned with creamed corn and fried shallots. Hubby got the parfait the volaille. Creamy and so decadent! For the main, i got the hanger steak with vegetables. Cooked to perfection! Everything!!! Felix got the catch of the day which was a crusted cod filet with barley and some sort of smokey reduction. Flaky, tender, perfect! The portions were so generous that we couldn't take anymore in! 

Ok... So i got irritated, even annoyed at first for waiting 45 minutes for a table (with reservations). But the superb service and delicious food made my husband and i a little happier in the end:)
